column4: what path im giving ? well im not sure, but im using ubuntu 8.10
Well, it comes up with this kamikaze@kamikaze-desktop:~$ sudo chmod +x /home/username/mount.sh
chmod: cannot access `/home/username/mount.sh': No such file or directory
kamikaze@kamikaze-desktop:~$
I doubt there's a user named "username" on your system
and you don't need sudo for the chmod command
ohh .. but it still cant .. it comes up with the same .. cant find thing ..
where did you download the file to?
I didnt dowlnoad any file?
well, where is the mount.sh file then?
the /home/whatever/mount.sh is a file path, telling where on the disk the file is.
of course, it actually has to be there for things to work
the error you get is saying it's not there, so perhaps it's somewhere else. where did you put it?
So the ISO file i want to mount shall be in the home folder before it would work ?
um, no. the _mount.sh_ file is missing
you need to mount an iso file or something? can't you do that in gnome?
Ohh... i think i just need to get the ISO file, i thought it was scripts i was installing by this, but now i know what to do when the iso file is on my Home :)
er, how does the .iso file matter? isn't your error with the mount.sh file?
yes cause the ISO file isnt on my computer yet.
you can do just "mount -oloop -tiso9660 file.iso /directory/to/mount/to"
Can i mount my ISO file just by writing that ??
